alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Hoke, Richmond and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 PM EDT, Most of the heavy rain has shifted north of the advisory area, although basins are still elevated. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laurinburg, Rockingham, Raeford, Hamlet, Antioch, Dobbins Heights, Wagram, Gibson, East Laurinburg, Laurel Hill, Bowmore, Silver City, East Rockingham, Diggs and Rockfish. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Rockfish Rd at Gully Branch and Richmond Mill Lake Dam. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
